margarita---the waiter raved about their margarita, but it was nothing special.

for a good burger i would recommend this place....the rest is up to you.

my awesome friend took me here for my birthday brunch...i absolutely enjoyed the company of my friend, but the food left a bad taste in my mouth.

-crispy bacon and <mark>Crispy Bacon  Hash Brown Quesadilla</mark>-it tasted burnt so i scraped a thick layer of cheese off my quesadilla and there was the reason why..so black.  i asked the waiter if this is how the quesadilla suppose to look like and he replied "yes...it comes out toasty."  i asked, "by toasty you mean burnt?  seriously?"  his answer was "yes."  i should have send that pile of charcoal back to the kitchen.  
-tiger shrimp & <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark>-i was looking forward to this dish.  however, major disappointment.   the tamale was dry and not much of it either.  flavor was just not there for me. 
-spicy chicken & <mark>Spicy Chicken  Sweet Potato Hash</mark>: this came with your choice of creamy grits or <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark>.  i was super excited to get a taste of home with the creamy grits.  it came out and i was like what the f is this cream of wheat looking bowl???  eek...i do not like it whatsover.  the spicy chicken & sweet potato was different but was decent to consume.

service may be good, but the server that attended us that day is one lazy person.  shame shame.

are you ready for a throw down?
apparently my tummy was and sadly bobby flay was not there personally to accept my challenge.

we had brunch here (no lunch on weekends..just brunch) to avoid paying $$$$ for dinner. cheap i know.
given that mr. flay is an iron chef i just had to try out his cooking.
the restaurant is tex-mex so keep that in mind. i read that the <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark> are the best thing to get here...but sadly i did not get it.

the bread basket was a nice perk as its not filled with your usual baguette or french loaf. it had blueberry bars, cookies, and mini biscuits. the dishes were carefully thought out and plated beautifully. 
i personally felt that the <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> (which are not french fries, btw) were a little tooooo salty.

i admit that this place is pricey. you'll pretty much be spending $20 or more per person. but you are in vegas! splurge a little!

this place is really good! i went there there for brunch. i had a carrot and <mark>Carrot / Mango Juice</mark> which was really good. i also had the <mark>Blue Corn Buttermilk Waffle</mark> which was different but good... it was sweet. <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> were okay, a little chewy/hard. another side they had was grits, i don't even like grits and i thought they were good.

halibuttttt was good...

cornbread? it wasn't bad..not as sweet as i thought..the other jalapeno and rasin bread was good... :)

the price wasn't bad for the portions..the burger was huge and the <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> were delicious with the wasabi aioli..

service was nice..the decor was nice..casual..low key..came here for lunch..not bad for all that food and feel stuffed for $80..

our group was really disappointed by mesa grill.  while planning our vegas trip, visiting bobby flay's restaurant was at the top of the list.  i am a fan of bobby flay and his food on food network looks amazing, but i would never recommend this restaurant to someone visiting vegas.

the hostess was rude when i informed her that our original group of 8 was now 10, which should have been a sign to go somewhere else to eat, but we soldiered on.  they split us up into a table for 4 and a table for 6.  the server had a thick accent and was difficult to understand.  the service was poor and the food took too long to come out.  

highlights:  bread basket- all of it was really good, especially the jalapeno bread, quesadilla was perfection ... the bacon, cheese, onions and bacon were amazing.  everyone at the table enjoyed it.  the ribeye steak, which was off menu, was excellent.  the <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> were also good.

low lights:  all of the egg dishes were really bland. the <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark> was bland and the sauce was too thin.  the mimosa was weak.  everyone hated the <mark>House Ground Hominy Grits</mark> ... our table was full of southerners, so grits have a high bar to meet and it failed miserably.

very disappointing and truly the culinary low light of our vegas trip.

another restaurant where i celebrated my birthday. located across from pure inside caesar's palace. it's a very colorful place and bobby flay's dishes are just as colorful and beautifully plated.

rough cut tuna nachos:
mango puree,  habanero hot sauce and avocado crema. sweetness of the mango + spicy hot sauce + creamy avocado. mmmmm...4.5/5

tiger shrimp and <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark>: 
i've been having a hard time finding good tamales in vegas.  this is an interesting version. perfectly cooked shrimps with a hint of garlic. 4/5

goat cheese queso fundido:
comes with blue corn chips. i love goat cheese. this queso fundido had the right amount of ooey-gooey cheesey goodness. we finished this in a few minutes. 4.5/5

yucatan style grouper with blue crab succotash sauce:
nothing really exciting going on with this dish. 3/5

<mark>Mesa Burger</mark> with <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark>:
good and well-seasoned burger.  it has double cheddar cheese, tomatoes and caramelized onions. the fries were crisp and flavorful and comes with a horseradish mustard. 4/5

<mark>Ancho Chile - Honey Glazed Salmon</mark>: 
comes with spicy black bean  sauce and roasted jalapeno crema. not the prettiest piece of salmon i've seen, ours looked like it was burnt. 3/5

mango buttermilk upside down cake: 
comes with rum caramel sauce and mango ice cream.  the cake itself was yummy then add mango ice cream? sweet! 5/5


deep dish banana cream pie:
cream and sliced bananas with praline wafer and hazelnut brittle on top. it was alright. 3/5

mexican chocolate pudding:
comes with gingersnap crumble.  yuck and i mean, yuck! this would have been a sure-hit for chocoholics like me if it wasn't for the gingersnap crumble and all the spices they added to the chocolate.  it was just too much. 1/5

restaurant week "best lunch" winner!

had a very enjoyable lunch here..all for a steal of $30??  this was a must-stop for me, just reading the menu offered...and i am happy to say that the food exceeded my high expectations!

starting off with the complimentary bread basket...the corn muffin was very good!  the others were also tasty and eaten up by little foodie!

for app, the <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark> ($18): corn and cilantro sauce. this was highly recommended for good reason...this was perfect lol!  very large, sweet and tender shrimps, very fluffy, tasty <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark> with a mouthwatering cilantro sauce! noms :d

of course, i went with the burger for entree!  green chile burger ($16): queso sauce, roasted poblanos, pickled red onions and <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark>. very good burger...juicy, and packed with flavor from the roasted peppers and onions. the fries were great, with a slightly salty spicy taste. worth it!  one of the better priced options on the strip that packs a punch!

to finish, caramel chocolate pudding ($11): malted whipped cream. this was good but not amazing...wish it would have finished the meal off strong! the candy bar bits on top were nice to mix together though.

service was great, prices were fair but a steal for rw menu!  i did have to put down a credit card for my reservation via opentable for the first time though...not a big deal to me, just keep it in mind.  

put it on your to-do list :p

pics!  :

we came here last thursday and this was the best lunch i've had in a while. i was pretty food happy after this visit and maybe a little sleepy too lol. i feel really bad that i forgot our server's name because he was super friendly and definitely not stuffy or high-nosed like some servers at higher end places. 

peach magarita:  i don't normally like margaritas because i prefer sweet or citrusy drinks but i really liked this one. it tasted more like a white sangria because there was barely any sourness so i enjoyed it.

pan roasted shrimp: this is the one i ordered and it  came with creamy green chile rice and smoked chile butter. the flavor was amazing and shrimp was big. it was also the perfect size since it was on the rich side. i could definitely see myself craving this for a creamy seafood fix.

<mark>Green Chile Cheeseburger</mark>: my boyfriend ordered this one but as usual i tasted it too lol it was a perfect medium rare and was very tender and juicy. it came with a slightly spicy queso sauce, roasted poblanos and pickled red onions. yummm! 

<mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark>: these came with the burger and were the best fries i've had in a while. super flavorful and whatever you do, ask for a side of peppered mayo. our server asked if we wanted some so we were like sure, why not. i was expecting well, pepper in mayo lol  but what we got was this tangy zesty sauce and it was soo good that my boyfriend even put it on his burger.

now let's talk their chocolate cajeta cake with vanilla swirl ice cream and salted chocolate crunch. i am in love. head over heels in love. my boyfriend is rolling his eyes while i'm saying this lol but really. i am warning you though, this is sweet tooth craving to the extreme. it was almost a little too sweet and rich for me after the first few bites but i am the type of person that will choose chocolate over any savory meal any day. soo if you're chocolate monster like i am, go for it!

we will definitely be back to try dinner and most likely for lunch again as well! a+ for mr.bobby flay.

sadly this place only get's 2-stars and here's why.

the place is beautiful, clean and well staffed. we explained to the hostess that we were in a bit of a time crunch so we couldn't take a leisure lunch. we had a plane to catch and needed food first.

we were seated promptly after a brief sit in the lovely waiting area.  our waiter greeted us and informed us he was aware we were in a bit of a time crunch.  he asked if we wanted waters and would bring the drink menu for us.

we got our waters and ordered drinks. i ordered one of their signature margaritas - the waiter explained the different between the (i think) 4 of them.  i choose the one he indicated was the sweetest some sort of cactus.  i found it to be less sweet than expected - but it was very good.  he then took our food order.

there were three of us and i'll list all our food and comment on those items i tried.

<mark>Sophie's Chopped Salad</mark> - with her own special dressing + crispy tortillas --- 13.  my friend ordered it and she loved it - i also tasted it and it was very good, seemed fresh, and had a bunch of interesting things in it. i loved the dressing.

yucatan chicken skewers - peanut - smoked chile barbecue sauce, flour tortillas, pickled red onion + mint --- 16.  beware - the peanut smoked chile barbecue sauce is very spicy - while i enjoyed it - my friend felt it was just a bit too hot and didn't really come with a "warning". she's not a fan of spicy food and avoided dipping her chicken into this. this dish was served with the tiniest flour tortillas.

<mark>Mesa Burger</mark> - double cheddar cheese, grilled vidalia onion + horseradish mustard served with <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> --- 18.  you like cheese? then you'll love this burger. it was ordered medium well and it came that way. meat was very tasty - but i am not a fan of cheese.  the <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> were a bit salty.

hot smoked salmon club <mark>Spicy Mango - Glazed Bacon</mark>, avocado, tomato, arugula, chipotle aioli + <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> --- 18.  this is what i ordered. i love seafood and was excited to try a smoked salmon club.  it came cut in half (thank you!) and was piled high with a cold smoked salmon mixture like the way tuna salad is mixed. you could taste the smoke and it reminded me of alder wood smoked salmon from the pacific northwest. the bacon was thick and cooked to perfection. lots of avocado. basically all the toppings were fresh and yummy and the sandwich oozed out from all angles. i loved the chipotle aoili sauce and actually used it to dip my fries into. i also felt the fries were a bit salty but dipping into the sauce sort of muted the over saltiness.  this sandwich is not a hot sandwich.

here's the reason mesa grill only get's 2 stars - within an hour after eating my hot smoked salmon club - i became sick ... i was in the cab on the way to the airport when it started to hit me and i was like oh great! i'm about to have to wait in lines and my luck there would be no bathroom for miles!!  i warned my friends and one offered some imodium - which i promptly took without water (yuck)!!  this same friend ate the other half of my sandwich on the way to the airport - so i warned her to be careful.  sure enough while loading onto the plane - she told me she wasn't feeling well either ... so that being said - 2 stars. you made me and my friend sick with your bad salmon!  i subtract a star for each time i had to run to the restroom with salmon revenge!!

the decor was beautiful and like i said waitstaff was terrific. serving bad salmon is no bueno!

bobby flay always seems to whip up the types of food i want shoved in my facehole. stat....... on iron chef. so i was suuuuper pumped to finally taste his food for lunch. (i know, not even the same realm as his iron chef fare. but still.)

i liked the interior. modern, clean, with clear southwestern elements thrown in without it being at all kitschy.

on to what's important - the food...

bread basket: jalapeno asiago bread, corn bread w/jalape\u00f1o cilantro and tomato (?), and blueberry walnut [3/5]
*** cold crumbly/dry bread, hard butter. was especially excited to try the two jalapeno breads and while you couldn't really taste the cheese nor jalapeno in the jalapeno asiago bread, the corn bread was pretty darn good.

blue corn pancake + barbecued duck w/habanero chile - star anise sauce $15 [3/5]
*** this was an ok dish. not too big a fan of the sauce. i think they were trying to work with the concept of a peking duck pancake here but was a little off on the execution. sounds like it's been on the menu for years so there might be fans out there. i'm just not one of them.

tiger shrimp + <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark> w/corn - cilantro sauce $16 [4.5/5]
*** the star of the meal. it's got a lot of rave reviews for good reason. it's on point visually, texture-wise, and most importantly, in flavor. 

new mexican spices <mark>New Mexican Spiced Pork Tenderloin Sandwich</mark> w/grilled red onion, arugula ancho chile mayonnaise + <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> $16 [4/5]
*** the ancho chile mayonnaise was mmmgoot. the pork tenderloin had a tasty rub as well. great flavors.

overall a solid meal but i probably wouldn't prioritize mesa over other vegas favorites. now..... where do i go in california/nevada to eat the kind of stuff he cooks on iron chef? or anywhere really?

we came here for the <mark>Mesa Burger</mark> and that is what we got.

let me say 1st that beware making a reservation via open table. we did and the cancellation policy states that if you don't cancel by the time they say, you will be charged. well, that time that was associated was the day before! wth?! yup, if we didn't cancel the reservation over 24 hours before we made it, we'd get charged. go figure. warning, you do have to leave a credit card to make a reservation.

i talked with the manager and he said the cancellation policy was not so. well, i showed him i-phone shots of our reservation (which i did not make) and he was astounded. he said he'd look into it.

anyway, without a reservation, we got a table for two immediately, just before a convention let out across the hall and the restaurant flooded with people. beware this point. i don't know how you would check, but if a convention is in residence and a seminar lets out, it's going to be tough to get seated.

so, onto the food. 

1st, the margarita. wow!...just wow! outstanding! beautifully done and tasted great. in fact, i could go for one right now! :)

next, the <mark>Mesa Burger</mark> * double cheddar cheese
grilled vidalia onion + horseradish mustard served with <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark>. it, too, was great. a definite keeper and something i'd go back for again. the meals around us looked equally delicious (my wife is a particular fan of meal stalking others, afraid she might miss the better dish).

lastly, before we got out meal, we were served with beautifully baked bread and spicy corn muffins. a real treat.

so, the downfall? well, it's extremely noisy since it's open to the casino and you can smell the cigarette smoke lingering.

all in all, a great burger is what we came for and that was what we got....with a bonus superb margarita and bread. yummy!

i love you bobby flay!

never had brunch this sexy and sophisticated! what a great place to dine when you don't want to wait for hours to get inside the bacchanal buffet or if you're simply looking for a great restaurant in vegas.

love the american southwest inspired interior. it's bright and colorful, but not obnoxious and has a non intimidating fine dining feel. food was amazing and very memorable. we came on a saturday brunch, and they serve traditional american brunch fare with a south-western twist. 

we had
-complimentary pastries -blue corn bread, mini jalapeno biscuits, coffee cake with butter on the side. everything was yummy!
-<mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark> $18- everyone's fav so i had to get it. 4 pieces of tiger shrimp on a bed of housemade tamale with roasted garlic cream sauce on top. it was was mix of a bit sweet from the tamale and savory from the shrimp and garlic sauce. amazing. get it! 
-<mark>Blue Corn Buttermilk Waffle</mark> $14 - crispy on the outside, light and soft on the inside. the bluecorn gave it a nutty flavor to the waffle. it's different and i liked it. it also had had enough black berry syrup that's not too sweet and the creme fraiche on top to cuts the sweetness. so good!
<mark>Spicy Mango - Glazed Bacon</mark> $4.50- recommended by our server. 2 thick strip of their house cured bacon with mango glaze on top. wow! never thought of mango with bacon and it's delicious! 
-<mark>Mesa Burger</mark> $18- perfectly cooked beef patty, double cheddar and grille onion. so simple yet delicious. it came with <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> (french fries with chili powder) and horseradish mustard dip. get it!

service was great. our server was very nice and attentive. the table next to us was actually very rude to our server, but he remained professional and killed them with kindness. i also asked if bobby ever comes to visit and he said about 3x a year since he is a very busy man.

came here for brunch and had the chilaqueles that were served with egg white on top of two hard shelled blue tortillas with chorizo and <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark>. the flavors were unique and robust. not something i would order again. the brunch menu seemed limited and nothing really caught my eye.

wow!! can i say delicious. service is impeccable, tasty scones served before main dish arrives. i ordered the tostada with chilie ancho. delicious, a great fusion of new mexico and mexican flavored. <mark>Southwestern Home Fries</mark> seasoned perfect. i love you bobby flay

i had the spicy chicken and <mark>Spicy Chicken  Sweet Potato Hash</mark> and it was outstanding. the side of <mark>House Ground Hominy Grits</mark> were delicious. we got a wonderful treat of a basket of assorted breads/cakes/muffins as well. very decent prices and i forced myself to finish every morsel and was stuffed! very nice waiter, very polite and knowledgeable about the menu. gave terrific recommendations. yay bobby flay!

i finally made it into mesa grill this weekend. my friend was always raving about their food and margaritas, so i was very excited to finally get to try it for myself. my boyfriend and i stopped by for brunch and we were pleasantly surprised. they brought out a bread basket while we waited for our appetizer. the bread was delicious! there were tiny jalapeno biscuits, cornbread, blueberry cake and a raisin scone. everything was perfect. the bread was warm and very fresh. i could seriously eat like 10 of those jalapeno biscuits!  

we ordered the goat cheese queso fundido as our appetizer. so good! the cheese was topped with red and green peppers. they served it with some light and crispy blue corn chips. i'm already craving this again...

for my entree i ordered the <mark>Spicy Scrambled Eggs</mark> chilaquiles. they were pretty good, but very different from the chilaquiles i'm used to eating. the tomatillo salsa was good, but my favorite part was the side of <mark>House Ground Hominy Grits</mark>. they were very flavorful!

my boyfriend ordered the spicy chicken and <mark>Spicy Chicken  Sweet Potato Hash</mark>. it was so good! if you like sweet potatoes, you will love this dish. it was the perfect balance of sweet and spicy. 

we didn't save room for dessert, so we will have to go back one of these days to give that a try. mesa grill is a place i can certainly see myself visiting again. i have to try their white peach margarita, after all!

we stopped here because we wanted breakfast. i was immediately pleased by the pleasant and 'quick to please' wait staff. the servers make sure your drinks never go empty or even half full. i ordered spicy scramble which comes with ham and biscuits. i also ordered the <mark>Tiger Shrimp  Roasted Garlic Corn Tamale</mark> appetizer which was so savory and had the best sauce; so delicious i could drink it. i've never heard of <mark>House Ground Hominy Grits</mark>, but i was raised eating hominy... this is so good, it reminds me of my happy childhood breakfasts with my grandmother. the bread basket was filled with sweet and spicy bite size treats. wonderful! very pleased.
